long_desc: Organizations have greatly expanded their use of teams to accomplish a wide variety of objectives. Teams develop new products, provide professional services, and start new businesses. Temporary teams are frequently assembled to make difficult decisions, solve crossfunctional problems, and generate new ideas. Advances in communication technology allow people dispersed across the globe to collaborate virtually, creating many new opportunities and challenges for leaders of such teams. This course will provide you the knowledge and skills to communicate in teams and to lead them effectively. It will help you better communicate in and lead teams and organizations. You will learn both effective leadership practices as well as how to avoid common leadership mistakes. Our readings reflect both the scientific and practice literatures and class exercises, cases, and projects provide the opportunity to apply what you learn. This course may use thirdparty course material that is not available for individual purchase from the publisher.   If so, the thirdparty course material will be secured and provided by the Tepper School to students enrolled in the course, and students enrolled in the course will be required to pay to the University the associated additional course materials fee for the thirdparty course material provided.   The amount of the course materials fee is dependent on the Universitys cost of the particular materials provided, and typically ranges from 13 to 75.

custom_fields.goals: Upon completing the course, a student will be able to do the following 1. Gain indepth understanding of team dynamics and their complexity across diverse settings including traditional organizations, computermediated settings and agile teams. 2. Recognize personal strengths in working with teams and areas they can improve3. Be able to recognize and manage common obstacles to a teams effectiveness 4. Advance skills in order to transition from team player to successful team leader
custom_fields.key_topics: Team dynamics, group decision making, flaws in team communication, virtual teams, leadership and power, shared leadership, leadership development, collective intelligence and superminds.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: No need for prerequisite; only motivation for personal development and achievement through others.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: You will be graded based on a group project, team and individual participation, assignments, and quizzes
custom_fields.relevance: This is an elective course offered by Tepper and Dietrich college. It examines important skills essential for effective and efficient groups and leadership development important for managing challenges in the workplace and optimize personal growth and career progress. This is definitely a higly inter-disciplinary course.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Detailed lecture notes will be available during the semester. Lecture notes, case studies, selected articles and book chapters.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Homework, group project meetings with other teammates outside classroom.
